item.title: Couldn't find connection vertex!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:2, topic:387925”]14 and -7 are the X and Y coordinates at the other end of the obstacle.
Change -7 to 0 and your character will walk 14 paces along the X axis.[/quote]

Trying that, i’ll tell you my results.

Edit: Thank you, sexy man. Rep4u

item.title: Couldn't find connection vertex!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

I’m trying to expand on Aintario’s agility and make it work for the Karamja agility course also. And basically, this is the code i’m using to make the player walk over the plank balance. case 3572: // plank if (c.absX == 2803 && c.absY == 9589) { c.obsticle(762, 1, 14, -7, 5000, 500, "You passed the obsticle succesfully."); c.gnomeObsticle = 1; } else if (c.absX == 2474 && c.absY == 3436) { c.obsticle(762, 1, 0, -7, 5000, 500, "You passed the obsticle succesfully."); } break;

The 14 part seems to be which direction the player walks in, i’ve changed it repeatedly and it’s changed the direction they walk. So basically, I found the number that works for the plank walk (makes them walk the correct direction) and it walks for 1 square then stops. I get an error in my servers prompt [player-1] Fatal: couldn't find connection vertex! Dropping packet. I’m assuming it’s doing this because it’s trying to walk on an object, but when i was changing around the numbers, it would make me walk through various other objects, so I seriously need some help.

Read full topic
